013package org.apache.juneau.dto.swagger;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
019import java.util.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
027
028/**
029 * This is the root document object for the API specification.
030 *
031 * <ul class='seealso'>
032 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-server.jrs.Swagger">Overview &gt; juneau-rest-server &gt; Swagger</a>
033 * </ul>
034 */
035@Bean(properties="swagger,info,tags,externalDocs,basePath,schemes,consumes,produces,paths,definitions,parameters,responses,securityDefinitions,security,*")
036@FluentSetters
037public class Swagger extends SwaggerElement {
038
039   /** Represents a null swagger */
040   public static final Swagger NULL = new Swagger();
041
042   private static final Comparator<String> PATH_COMPARATOR = new Comparator<String>() {
043      @Override /* Comparator */
044      public int compare(String o1, String o2) {
045         return o1.replace('{', '@').compareTo(o2.replace('{', '@'));
046      }
047   };
048
049   private String
050      swagger = "2.0",
051      host,
052      basePath;
053   private Info info;
054   private ExternalDocumentation externalDocs;
055   private Set<String> schemes;
056   private Set<MediaType>
057      consumes,
058      produces;
059   private Set<Tag> tags;
060   private List<Map<String,List<String>>> security;
061   private Map<String,JsonMap> definitions;
062   private Map<String,ParameterInfo> parameters;
063   private Map<String,ResponseInfo> responses;
064   private Map<String,SecurityScheme> securityDefinitions;
065   private Map<String,OperationMap> paths;
066
067   /**
068    * Default constructor.
069    */
070   public Swagger() {}
071
072   /**
073    * Copy constructor.
074    *
075    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
076    */
077   public Swagger(Swagger copyFrom) {
078      super(copyFrom);
079
080      this.basePath = copyFrom.basePath;
081      this.consumes = copyOf(copyFrom.consumes);
082      this.externalDocs = copyFrom.externalDocs == null ? null : copyFrom.externalDocs.copy();
083      this.host = copyFrom.host;
084      this.info = copyFrom.info == null ? null : copyFrom.info.copy();
085      this.produces = copyOf(copyFrom.produces);
086      this.schemes = copyOf(copyFrom.schemes);
087      this.swagger = copyFrom.swagger;
088
089      // TODO - Definitions are not deep copied, so they should not contain references.
090      if (copyFrom.definitions == null) {
091         this.definitions = null;
092      } else {
093         this.definitions = map();
094         copyFrom.definitions.forEach((k,v) -> this.definitions.put(k, new JsonMap(v)));
095      }
096
097      if (copyFrom.paths == null) {
098         this.paths = null;
099      } else {
100         this.paths = map();
101         copyFrom.paths.forEach((k,v) -> {
102            OperationMap m = new OperationMap();
103            v.forEach((k2,v2) -> m.put(k2, v2.copy()));
104            this.paths.put(k, m);
105         });
106      }
107
108      if (copyFrom.parameters == null) {
109         this.parameters = null;
110      } else {
111         this.parameters = map();
112         copyFrom.parameters.forEach((k,v) -> this.parameters.put(k, v.copy()));
113      }
114
115      if (copyFrom.responses == null) {
116         this.responses = null;
117      } else {
118         this.responses = map();
119         copyFrom.responses.forEach((k,v) -> this.responses.put(k, v.copy()));
120      }
121
122      if (copyFrom.security == null) {
123         this.security = null;
124      } else {
125         this.security = list();
126         copyFrom.security.forEach(x -> {
127            Map<String,List<String>> m2 = map();
128            x.forEach((k,v) -> m2.put(k, copyOf(v)));
129            this.security.add(m2);
130         });
131      }
132
133      if (copyFrom.securityDefinitions == null) {
134         this.securityDefinitions = null;
135      } else {
136         this.securityDefinitions = map();
137         copyFrom.securityDefinitions.forEach((k,v) -> this.securityDefinitions.put(k, v.copy()));
138      }
139
140      if (copyFrom.tags == null) {
141         this.tags = null;
142      } else {
143         this.tags = CollectionUtils.set();
144         copyFrom.tags.forEach(x -> this.tags.add(x.copy()));
145      }
146   }
147
148   /**
149    * Make a deep copy of this object.
150    *
151    * @return A deep copy of this object.
152    */
153   public Swagger copy() {
154      return new Swagger(this);
155   }
156
157   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
158   // Properties
159   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
160
161   /**
162    * Bean property getter:  <property>basePath</property>.
163    *
164    * <p>
165    * The base path on which the API is served, which is relative to the <c>host</c>.
166    *
167    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
168    */
169   public String getBasePath() {
170      return basePath;
171   }
172
173   /**
174    * Bean property setter:  <property>basePath</property>.
175    *
176    * <p>
177    * The base path on which the API is served, which is relative to the <c>host</c>.
178    *
179    * @param value
180    *    The new value for this property.
181    *    <br>If it is not included, the API is served directly under the <c>host</c>.
182    *    <br>The value MUST start with a leading slash (/).
183    *    <br>The <c>basePath</c> does not support <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#pathTemplating">path templating</a>.
184    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
185    * @return This object.
186    */
187   public Swagger setBasePath(String value) {
188      basePath = value;
189      return this;
190   }
191
192   /**
193    * Bean property getter:  <property>consumes</property>.
194    *
195    * <p>
196    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
197    *
198    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
199    */
200   public Set<MediaType> getConsumes() {
201      return consumes;
202   }
203
204   /**
205    * Bean property setter:  <property>consumes</property>.
206    *
207    * <p>
208    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
209    *
210    * @param value
211    *    The new value for this property.
212    *    <br>Value MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
213    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
214    * @return This object.
215    */
216   public Swagger setConsumes(Collection<MediaType> value) {
217      consumes = setFrom(value);
218      return this;
219   }
220
221   /**
222    * Bean property appender:  <property>consumes</property>.
223    *
224    * <p>
225    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
226    *
227    * @param values
228    *    The values to add to this property.
229    *    <br>Values MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
230    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
231    * @return This object.
232    */
233   public Swagger addConsumes(MediaType...values) {
234      consumes = setBuilder(consumes).sparse().add(values).build();
235      return this;
236   }
237
238   /**
239    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>consumes</property>.
240    *

243    *
244    * @param value
245    *    The values to set on this property.
246    * @return This object.
247    */
248   public Swagger setConsumes(MediaType...value) {
249      setConsumes(setBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().add(value).build());
250      return this;
251   }

289    * @return This object.

293      return this;
294   }

324   /**
325    * Bean property getter:  <property>host</property>.
326    *
327    * <p>
328    * The host (name or IP) serving the API.
329    *
330    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
331    */
332   public String getHost() {
333      return host;
334   }
335
336   /**
337    * Bean property setter:  <property>host</property>.
338    *
339    * <p>
340    * The host (name or IP) serving the API.
341    *
342    * @param value
343    *    The new value for this property.
344    *    <br>This MUST be the host only and does not include the scheme nor sub-paths.
345    *    <br>It MAY include a port.
346    *    <br>If the host is not included, the host serving the documentation is to be used (including the port).
347    *    <br>The host does not support <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#pathTemplating">path templating</a>
348    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
349    * @return This object.
350    */
351   public Swagger setHost(String value) {
352      host = value;
353      return this;
354   }
355

357    * Bean property getter:  <property>info</property>.
358    *

360    * Provides metadata about the API.
361    *
362    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
363    */
364   public Info getInfo() {
365      return info;
366   }
367
368   /**
369    * Bean property setter:  <property>info</property>.
370    *
371    * <p>
372    * Provides metadata about the API.
373    *
374    * @param value
375    *    The new value for this property.
376    *    <br>Property value is required.

378    */

380      info = value;
381      return this;
382   }

391    */
392   public Map<String,ParameterInfo> getParameters() {
393      return parameters;
394   }

398    *
399    * <p>
400    * An object to hold parameters that can be used across operations.
401    *

404    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
405    * @return This object.
406    */

408      parameters = copyOf(value);
409      return this;
410   }

412   /**
413    * Bean property appender:  <property>parameters</property>.
414    *
415    * <p>
416    * Adds a single value to the <property>parameter</property> property.
417    *
418    * @param name The parameter name.
419    * @param parameter The parameter definition.
420    * @return This object.
421    */
422   public Swagger addParameter(String name, ParameterInfo parameter) {
423      parameters = mapBuilder(parameters).sparse().add(name, parameter).build();
424      return this;
425   }
426
427   /**
428    * Bean property getter:  <property>paths</property>.
429    *
430    * <p>
431    * The available paths and operations for the API.
432    *
433    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
434    */
435   public Map<String,OperationMap> getPaths() {
436      return paths;
437   }
438
439   /**
440    * Bean property setter:  <property>paths</property>.
441    *
442    * <p>
443    * The available paths and operations for the API.
444    *
445    * @param value
446    *    The new value for this property.
447    *    <br>Property value is required.
448    * @return This object.
449    */
450   public Swagger setPaths(Map<String,OperationMap> value) {
451      paths = mapBuilder(String.class,OperationMap.class).sparse().sorted(PATH_COMPARATOR).addAll(value).build();
452      return this;
453   }
454
455   /**
456    * Bean property appender:  <property>paths</property>.
457    *
458    * <p>
459    * Adds a single value to the <property>paths</property> property.
460    *
461    * @param path The path template.
462    * @param methodName The HTTP method name.
463    * @param operation The operation that describes the path.
464    * @return This object.
465    */
466   public Swagger addPath(String path, String methodName, Operation operation) {
467      if (paths == null)
468         paths = new TreeMap<>(PATH_COMPARATOR);
469      OperationMap p = paths.get(path);
470      if (p == null) {
471         p = new OperationMap();
472         paths.put(path, p);
473      }
474      p.put(methodName, operation);
475      return this;
476   }
477

479    * Bean property getter:  <property>produces</property>.

482    * A list of MIME types the APIs can produce.

583    * Bean property getter:  <property>schemes</property>.

589    */

591      return schemes;
592   }
593
594   /**
595    * Bean property setter:  <property>schemes</property>.
596    *
597    * <p>
598    * The transfer protocol of the API.
599    *
600    * @param value
601    *    The new value for this property.
602    *    <br>Valid values:
603    *    <ul>
604    *       <li><js>"http"</js>
605    *       <li><js>"https"</js>
606    *       <li><js>"ws"</js>
607    *       <li><js>"wss"</js>
608    *    </ul>
609    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
610    * @return This object.
611    */
612   public Swagger setSchemes(Collection<String> value) {
613      schemes = setFrom(value);
614      return this;
615   }
616
617   /**
618    * Bean property appender:  <property>schemes</property>.
619    *
620    * <p>
621    * The transfer protocol of the API.
622    *
623    * @param values
624    *    The values to add to this property.
625    *    <br>Valid values:
626    *    <ul>
627    *       <li><js>"http"</js>
628    *       <li><js>"https"</js>
629    *       <li><js>"ws"</js>
630    *       <li><js>"wss"</js>
631    *    </ul>
632    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
633    * @return This object.
634    */
635   public Swagger addSchemes(String...values) {
636      schemes = setBuilder(schemes).sparse().add(values).build();
637      return this;
638   }
639
640   /**
641    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>schemes</property>.
642    *
643    * <p>
644    * The transfer protocol of the API.
645    *
646    * @param value
647    *    The new value for this property.
648    *    <br>Strings can be JSON arrays.
649    * @return This object.
650    */
651   public Swagger setSchemes(String...value) {
652      setSchemes(setBuilder(String.class).sparse().addJson(value).build());
653      return this;
654   }
655
656   /**
657    * Bean property getter:  <property>security</property>.
658    *
659    * <p>
660    * A declaration of which security schemes are applied for the API as a whole.
661    *
662    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
663    */
664   public List<Map<String,List<String>>> getSecurity() {
665      return security;
666   }
667
668   /**
669    * Bean property setter:  <property>security</property>.
670    *
671    * <p>
672    * A declaration of which security schemes are applied for the API as a whole.
673    *
674    * @param value
675    *    The new value for this property.
676    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
677    * @return This object.
678    */
679   public Swagger setSecurity(Collection<Map<String,List<String>>> value) {
680      security = listFrom(value);
681      return this;
682   }
683
684   /**
685    * Bean property appender:  <property>security</property>.
686    *
687    * <p>
688    * Adds a single value to the <property>securityDefinitions</property> property.
689    *
690    * @param scheme The security scheme that applies to this operation
691    * @param alternatives
692    *    The list of values describes alternative security schemes that can be used (that is, there is a logical OR between the security requirements).
693    * @return This object.
694    */
695   public Swagger addSecurity(String scheme, String...alternatives) {
696      Map<String,List<String>> m = map();
697      m.put(scheme, alist(alternatives));
698      security = listBuilder(security).sparse().addAll(Collections.singleton(m)).build();
699      return this;
700   }
701
702   /**
703    * Bean property getter:  <property>securityDefinitions</property>.
704    *
705    * <p>
706    * Security scheme definitions that can be used across the specification.
707    *
708    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
709    */
710   public Map<String,SecurityScheme> getSecurityDefinitions() {
711      return securityDefinitions;
712   }
713
714   /**
715    * Bean property setter:  <property>securityDefinitions</property>.
716    *
717    * <p>
718    * Security scheme definitions that can be used across the specification.
719    *
720    * @param value
721    *    The new value for this property.
722    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
723    * @return This object.
724    */
725   public Swagger setSecurityDefinitions(Map<String,SecurityScheme> value) {
726      securityDefinitions = copyOf(value);
727      return this;
728   }
729
730   /**
731    * Bean property appender:  <property>securityDefinitions</property>.
732    *
733    * <p>
734    * Adds a single value to the <property>securityDefinitions</property> property.
735    *
736    * @param name A security name.
737    * @param securityScheme A security schema.
738    * @return This object.
739    */
740   public Swagger addSecurityDefinition(String name, SecurityScheme securityScheme) {
741      securityDefinitions = mapBuilder(securityDefinitions).sparse().add(name, securityScheme).build();
742      return this;
743   }
744
745   /**

747    *
748    * <p>
749    * Specifies the Swagger Specification version being used.

753   public String getSwagger() {
754      return swagger;

768   public Swagger setSwagger(String value) {
769      swagger = value;
770      return this;

773   /**
774    * Bean property getter:  <property>tags</property>.
775    *
776    * <p>
777    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
778    *
779    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
780    */
781   public Set<Tag> getTags() {
782      return tags;
783   }
784
785   /**
786    * Bean property setter:  <property>tags</property>.
787    *
788    * <p>
789    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
790    *
791    * @param value
792    *    The new value for this property.
793    *    <br>The order of the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools.
794    *    <br>Not all tags that are used by the <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#operationObject">Operation Object</a> must be declared.
795    *    <br>The tags that are not declared may be organized randomly or based on the tools' logic.
796    *    <br>Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.
797    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
798    * @return This object.
799    */
800   public Swagger setTags(Collection<Tag> value) {
801      tags = setFrom(value);
802      return this;
803   }
804
805   /**
806    * Bean property appender:  <property>tags</property>.
807    *
808    * <p>
809    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
810    *
811    * @param values
812    *    The values to add to this property.
813    *    <br>The order of the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools.
814    *    <br>Not all tags that are used by the <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#operationObject">Operation Object</a> must be declared.
815    *    <br>The tags that are not declared may be organized randomly or based on the tools' logic.
816    *    <br>Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.
817    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
818    * @return This object.
819    */
820   public Swagger addTags(Tag...values) {
821      tags = setBuilder(tags).sparse().add(values).build();
822      return this;
823   }

825   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
826   // Convenience methods
827   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
828
829   /**
830    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path);</c>
831    *
832    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
833    * @return The operation map for the specified path, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
834    */
835   public OperationMap getPath(String path) {
836      return getPaths().get(path);
837   }
838
839   /**
840    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation);</c>
841    *
842    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
843    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).
844    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
845    */
846   public Operation getOperation(String path, String operation) {
847      OperationMap om = getPath(path);
848      if (om == null)
849         return null;
850      return om.get(operation);
851   }
852
853   /**
854    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation).getResponse(status);</c>
855    *
856    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
857    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).
858    * @param status The HTTP response status (e.g. <js>"200"</js>).
859    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
860    */
861   public ResponseInfo getResponseInfo(String path, String operation, String status) {
862      OperationMap om = getPath(path);
863      if (om == null)
864         return null;
865      Operation op = om.get(operation);
866      if (op == null)
867         return null;
868      return op.getResponse(status);
869   }
870
871   /**
872    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation).getResponse(status);</c>
873    *
874    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
875    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).
876    * @param status The HTTP response status (e.g. <js>"200"</js>).
877    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
878    */
879   public ResponseInfo getResponseInfo(String path, String operation, int status) {
880      return getResponseInfo(path, operation, String.valueOf(status));
881   }
882
883   /**
884    * Convenience method for calling <c>getPath(path).get(method).getParameter(in,name);</c>
885    *
886    * @param path The HTTP path.
887    * @param method The HTTP method.
888    * @param in The parameter type.
889    * @param name The parameter name.
890    * @return The parameter information or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
891    */
892   public ParameterInfo getParameterInfo(String path, String method, String in, String name) {
893      OperationMap om = getPath(path);
894      if (om != null) {
895         Operation o = om.get(method);
896         if (o != null) {
897            return o.getParameter(in, name);
898         }
899      }
900      return null;
901   }
902
903   // <FluentSetters>
904
905   // </FluentSetters>
906
907   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
908   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
909      if (property == null)
910         return null;
911      switch (property) {
912         case "basePath": return toType(getBasePath(), type);
913         case "consumes": return toType(getConsumes(), type);
914         case "definitions": return toType(getDefinitions(), type);
915         case "externalDocs": return toType(getExternalDocs(), type);
916         case "host": return toType(getHost(), type);
917         case "info": return toType(getInfo(), type);
918         case "parameters": return toType(getParameters(), type);
919         case "paths": return toType(getPaths(), type);
920         case "produces": return toType(getProduces(), type);
921         case "responses": return toType(getResponses(), type);
922         case "schemes": return toType(getSchemes(), type);
923         case "security": return toType(getSecurity(), type);
924         case "securityDefinitions": return toType(getSecurityDefinitions(), type);
925         case "swagger": return toType(getSwagger(), type);
926         case "tags": return toType(getTags(), type);
927         default: return super.get(property, type);
928      }
929   }
930
931   @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
932   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
933   public Swagger set(String property, Object value) {
934      if (property == null)
935         return this;
936      switch (property) {
937         case "basePath": return setBasePath(stringify(value));
938         case "consumes": return setConsumes(listBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
939         case "definitions": return setDefinitions(mapBuilder(String.class,JsonMap.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
940         case "externalDocs": return setExternalDocs(toType(value, ExternalDocumentation.class));
941         case "host": return setHost(stringify(value));
942         case "info": return setInfo(toType(value, Info.class));
943         case "parameters": return setParameters(mapBuilder(String.class,ParameterInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
944         case "paths": return setPaths(mapBuilder(String.class,OperationMap.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
945         case "produces": return setProduces(listBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
946         case "responses": return setResponses(mapBuilder(String.class,ResponseInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
947         case "schemes": return setSchemes(listBuilder(String.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
948         case "security": return setSecurity((List)listBuilder(Map.class,String.class,List.class,String.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
949         case "securityDefinitions": return setSecurityDefinitions(mapBuilder(String.class,SecurityScheme.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
950         case "swagger": return setSwagger(stringify(value));
951         case "tags": return setTags(listBuilder(Tag.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
952         default:
953            super.set(property, value);
954            return this;
955      }
956   }
957
958   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
959   public Set<String> keySet() {
960      Set<String> s = setBuilder(String.class)
961         .addIf(basePath != null, "basePath")
962         .addIf(consumes != null, "consumes")
963         .addIf(definitions != null, "definitions")
964         .addIf(externalDocs != null, "externalDocs")
965         .addIf(host != null, "host")
966         .addIf(info != null, "info")
967         .addIf(parameters != null, "parameters")
968         .addIf(paths != null, "paths")
969         .addIf(produces != null, "produces")
970         .addIf(responses != null, "responses")
971         .addIf(schemes != null, "schemes")
972         .addIf(security != null, "security")
973         .addIf(securityDefinitions != null, "securityDefinitions")
974         .addIf(swagger != null, "swagger")
975         .addIf(tags != null, "tags")
976         .build();
977      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
978   }

980   /**
981    * A synonym of {@link #toString()}.
982    * @return This object serialized as JSON.
983    */
984   public String asJson() {
985      return toString();
986   }
987
988   @Override /* Object */
989   public String toString() {
990      return JsonSerializer.DEFAULT.toString(this);
991   }
992
993   /**
994    * Resolves a <js>"$ref"</js> tags to nodes in this swagger document.
995    *
996    * @param <T> The class to convert the reference to.
997    * @param ref The ref tag value.
998    * @param c The class to convert the reference to.
999    * @return The referenced node, or <jk>null</jk> if the ref was <jk>null</jk> or empty or not found.
1000    */
1001   public <T> T findRef(String ref, Class<T> c) {
1002      if (isEmpty(ref))
1003         return null;
1004      if (! ref.startsWith("#/"))
1005         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Unsupported reference:  ''{0}''", ref);
1006      try {
1007         return new ObjectRest(this).get(ref.substring(1), c);
1008      } catch (Exception e) {
1009         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, c, "Reference ''{0}'' could not be converted to type ''{1}''.", ref, className(c));
1010      }
1011   }
1012}
